intro: Aruba glabra, commonly known as the smooth aruba, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is native to certain regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous stems and leaves that are typically trifoliate. It produces small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. Aruba glabra is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
